data.event: The name was selected by the railway department when the Sunnybank/South Coast Railway Line opened in 1885.

event.title: were built in the area, along what is now

data.event: Because of its comparative remoteness, a series of munition factories were built in the area, along what is now Evans Road.
The tram line from the city to Moorooka was extended in 1941 to Evans Road to service these factories.
The tram line finally closed on 13 April 1969.

event.title: 1943, the production of small arms at the Rocklea Factory had ceased

data.event: By the end of October 1943, the production of small arms at the Rocklea Factory had ceased and the place was ready for re-occupation and conversion to engine overhaul for the Department of Aircraft Production.
